sense.name: Physically move (something) into the center.
sense.examples: She centered the vase and rearranged the scarf on top of the upright piano. Use these guidelines to center your aim. She centered her gravity, as she usually did, just before attacking. Center the heading an inch from the top of the page.

sense.name: focus (on)
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] CENTER NP2[patient] PP NP1[theme] CENTER on PP Includes: CENTER ON
sense.examples: They centered a large part of the attack on you. They centered their world around a single capital at Chichen Itza. You make it sound like he centered the whole thing around his PS3. The region's growth centered squarely on the Circle. Although the specific teachings of this school are unclear, they centered on number mysticism. The issues on many gamers' minds centered squarely on Sony and Nintendo. In the past, such efforts centered mainly on Jordan.

sense.name: Make a small hole as a guide for a drill.
sense.examples: Center punch the holes as indicated on the template.
